data_class¶

The file classes.py containes the class Data, which loads and analyses the meteorological data from the file filename.grib.

class data_class.Data(filename, code)¶

The class Data loads data from the .grib file and performs the desired manipulations on it. A Data object is the used by the functions from the plot module to produce plots.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location and filename of the .grib file

  • code (str) – short name of the dataset to filter the convenient messages

Returns

Return type

None.

ann_mean(anno)¶

Computes the mean with respect to space of the values of the Data object for the given year.

Parameters

anno (int) – year of interest

Returns

data – 2x2 array containing the temporal means over the given year for each grid point

Return type

np.array(dtype=float)

comp_mean_space()¶

Computes the mean with respect to space of the values of the Data object.

Returns

  • mean (np.array(dtype=float)) – time series with the spatial means for each month

  • std (np.array(dtype=float)) – time series with the spatial standard deviations for each month

comp_mean_time()¶

Computes the mean with respect to space of the values of the Data object.

Returns

2x2 array containing the temporal means for each grid point

Return type

np.array(dtype=float)

get_coord()¶

Returns the coordinate grid to which the values of the Data object refer.

Returns

  • np.array(dtype=float) – array of latitudes

  • np.array(dtype=float) – array of longitudes

get_mean_per_season()¶

Computes the global mean for each month sorted by season.

Returns

data – list of spatial means

Return type

list of np.arrays

get_name()¶

Returns the name of the data with its unit.

Returns

name of variable / unit

Return type

str

get_season_mean(season)¶

Computes and returns the temporally averaged data for a specified season.

Parameters

season (int) – key for the season: winter = 0, spring = 1, summer = 3, autumn = 4

Returns

data – 2x2 array with the averaged data

Return type

np.array(dtype=float)

get_space_mean()¶

Returnes the mean with respect to space of the values of the Data object. If the mean does not exist yet, it gets computed with comp_mean_space().

Returns

  • mean (np.array(dtype=float)) – time series with the spatial means for each month

  • std (np.array(dtype=float)) – time series with the spatial standard deviations for each month

get_time_mean()¶

Returnes the mean with respect to space of the values of the Data object. If the mean does not exist yet, it gets computed with comp_mean_time().

Returns

2x2 array containing the temporal means for each grid point

Return type

np.array(dtype=float)

reduce_grid(inpt, lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max)¶

Returns the data of inpt reduced to a grid with the borders lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max.

Parameters

  • inpt (np.array(dtype=float)) – 2x2 array on which the grid reduction is performed

  • lon_min (float) – lower longitude boundary

  • lon_max (float) – upper longitude boundary

  • lat_min (float) – lower latitude boundary

  • lat_max (float) – upper latitude boundary

Returns

  • data (np.array(dtype=float)) – values with reduced grid

  • lat (np.array(dtype=float)) – array of latitudes for reduced grid

  • lon (np.array(dtype=float)) – array of longitudes for reduced grid
